meanings.definition: A former British coin worth one quarter of a penny.
meanings.sent1: In the olden days, people used farthings to buy sweets.
meanings.sent2: He found a jar filled with farthings in his grandfather's attic.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended her farthings were magical coins.
meanings.sent4: His kindness was like a handful of farthings in a world of gold.
meanings.sent5: The sound of farthings jingling in his pocket was music to his ears.

meanings.sent1: She saved every farthing she earned to buy a new book.
meanings.sent2: The farmer didn't have a farthing left after the storm destroyed his crops.
meanings.sent3: His excuse was worth less than a farthing in her eyes.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's praise meant more to him than all the farthings in the world.
meanings.sent5: The value of friendship cannot be measured in farthings.
